name: The Alexander
description: A classic, creamy dessert drink that is most famously known in its modern variation, the Brandy Alexander. The original gin-based version appeared in print as early as 1916, while the brandy version, which has largely surpassed the original in popularity, emerged in the 1920s.
directions: Chill a glass: Place a coupe or martini glass in the freezer or fill it with ice and water while you prepare the drink.
Combine ingredients: Add the brandy, cr√®me de cacao, and cream into a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously: Shake well for 15-20 seconds until the mixture is frothy and the outside of the shaker is very cold.
Strain and serve: Strain the mixture into your chilled glass. For a smoother texture, you can double-strain through a fine mesh strainer.
Garnish: Grate fresh nutmeg over the top and serve immediately.
